definition: see-saw/also written 蹺蹺板|跷跷板[qiao1 qiao1 ban3]
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
to stick up/to rise on one end/to tilt
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: There is a red seesaw in the park.
sentences.chinese: 公园里有个红色的翘翘板。

sentences.english: Is there a seesaw in your room?
sentences.chinese: 你的房间里有架翘翘板吗？

sentences.english: You can also have low, padded and carpeted seesaws.
sentences.chinese: 你还可以用零角碎料，制作低矮的翘翘板。

definition: swing (seat hung from a frame or branch)

beat the drum, pass the flower (game in which players sit in a circle passing a flower around while a drum is beaten – when the drumbeat stops, the player holding the flower must sing a song, answer a question, or drink a glass of wine etc)
sandpit (for children's play or for long jump etc)/sandbox
tug-of-war/to take part in a tug-of-war
merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
